body: @matthiasblaesing There isn't any problem for me if you prefer squash the changes.

I am not sure what you are trying to do but I am pretty sure this is not the right way to do it.

The `maven` module displays package roots for any `build/generated-{,test-}sources/*/` it finds. The fact that these are `NOT_SHARABLE` is irrelevant.

Thanks, Jesse!
Checked the Maven implementation and made something similar in Gradle as well.

Apologies.
Merged via https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/aec700e82092af3851fd9d8883eadfcd942ee035. Thank you.

Nice, thanks a lot.
Thank you!

> How can I combine all my patches to a just one pull request? directly on github.com

Maybe, it's impossible.

You should create a new PR as just one commit with your all changes, I suppose.

Please add the issue number to your commit message and PR title. e.g. [NETBEANS-****] title (Please have a look at this: https://netbeans.apache.org/participate/submit-pr.html)

Thanks for your contribution.

A PR on github is a branch with (potentially) multiple commits. Think of a PR as a group of related commits, where each commits forms a separate change and the whole group of commit archives a certain goal. Commits should form logical units and PRs group these.

If you notice, that a commit is missing for a PR, you can update that PR by adding the commit to the branch the PR was created from. Github will reflect the change to the branch into the PR.
Or please add your changes (#1478 and #1479) to your `patch-1`branch (#1477).
If noone objects, I'll fix the merge conflicts by Wednesday and merge then.
What was done to verify, that the exported API is sane?
PR https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1405 is now separated in multiple PR per modules. Updated the description for the usage of API in Jeddict plugin.
Don't take this wrong, but I repeat my question: What was done to verify, that the API is sane? I'm not too happy with the DB modules api.
Is there still interest in this?

Hi @matthiasblaesing,

What's the process to check the sanity of the module e.g more unit tests, examples needed etc?

- https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/ide/bugtracking.commons/nbproject/project.xml
- https://github.com/junichi11/netbeans-github-issues-plugin/blob/master/pom.xml
Well, if no one has comment against this, I'm going to merge this one tomorrow morning (PDT). As the change is pretty small this can be removed later if it would cause problems.

Hi @junichi11,

In the PR https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1405, I have added the codenamebase as a friend but @neilcsmith-net suggested to remove the friend-only restrictions. 
So I am creating PRs for all the modules required by Jeddict which have API/SPI packages and exported to friends marked as public.

Looks good to me.

@matthiasblaesing thanks for the offer to review.  This won't affect PraxisLIVE, as [for a long time](https://praxisintermedia.wordpress.com/2012/01/04/jna-3-4-0-on-the-netbeans-platform/) it has shipped with its own choice of version.

I can't test this until next week, but +1 in principle to this change.  It would also be good to remove the friend API restriction here?  JNA is top of my annoying use of friend API with third-party dependencies!  If you read the blog post link above, you'll notice me moaning about this in 2012. :smile:

> What's the process to check the sanity of the module e.g more unit tests, examples needed etc?

That is a good question, but I think outside the scope of a PR discussion: this is the reason I asked what was done. I would like to discuss this on the mailinglist to get some more people to voice their opinion.

As we are nearing feature freeze, I would like to postpone this till release of 11.2 is done. As a work around, could you use yenta (https://github.com/jglick/yenta)?

Sorry, but you'll need to review your git commits. Have a look at your commits with `gitk`, `git log -n 10 --graph --oneline`  or some other history visualizing tool. In a single PR I would expect a single string of commits (merging in a PR is _very_ rare). In this case it looks as if there are two very similar commits, that show small differences and are then merged.
It may help to remember how a github PR works: You create a branch with the code you want a project to merge. In this branch you add commits, that (in the best case) form logical groups of changes. If you want to update the PR, you can add commits to that branch. If multiple commits are done in the branch, that form one logical changeset, we can merge these commits at merge time.
If important changes from master are needed, you can merge or rebase. A rebase is more difficult, but creates a cleaner commit history and makes it easier to cleanup a PR at the end and spot the changes done to it.
Please also check your git settings. You switched identity from Brad to Charles (email).
@jlahoda thank you for the review
@jGauravGupta as this is Payara related, would you be kind enough to check you are happy with this very minor change? :)  cheers!

Please apply this patch to your `patch-1` branch  if needed: 
```
git pull https://github.com/junichi11/netbeans netbeans-2722
```
or
```
curl -L https://github.com/junichi11/netbeans/commit/d6cf197097b82c9a6848088bef59b809472a7920.patch | git am
```

Please do that from next time :)

OK. Actually Geertjan told me to do that but using the word "description" I didn't realize I have to put the bug code in the title. Next time! :-)

@riksoft If you apply my patch(keep the last diff window size) to your `patch-1` branch, please push it.
```
$ cd netbeans
$ git pull https://github.com/junichi11/netbeans netbeans-2722
$ git push origin patch-1
```
 Otherwise, please let me know.

For the code itself: The javafx-archetype-simple archetype is invalid, it is only present in version 0.0.1, not 0.0.2, the same is true for javafx-archetype-fxml.

The list in the "Java with Maven" category becomes pretty long. Maybe we should use a subfolder "From Archetype", where the generic "Project from Archetype" is the first option and selected archetypes come after it. This is my try to illustrate it:

Before:

![now](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2179736/64728987-8c1b3e00-d4dc-11e9-95f8-9cec512a2346.png)

After:

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2179736/64728994-8faec500-d4dc-11e9-8209-e3b4ca618566.png)

[1] https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/0580490be48a9a2ec6279218fd0e39561affdab8/php/php.editor/test/unit/src/org/netbeans/modules/php/editor/typinghooks/PhpTypedTextInterceptorTest.java#L645-L647

0.0.2 was definitely available recently, will check.

Agree completely with your folder restructuring -- or maybe those from archetype should be in the Samples category instead?

I.e., I think the Samples category should be just like the standard category: "Java with Maven" (which would be the Gluon OpenJFX samples), "Java with Ant" (which would be the content of the current Java as well as the current JavaFX samples).
